Authors:
Helena Bragança, Eugenio Luis Fraga Diogo, Lucinda Neves,
Carlos Valente, Clara Araújo, Luis Bonifácio, Alan John Lander
Phillips
Title:
Quambalaria eucalypti a newly reported pathogen on Eucalyptus
globulus in Portugal
Abstract:
The Eucalyptus pathogen Quambalaria eucalypti has been
reported from several subtropical and tropical countries of the Southern
Hemisphere. During the course of a nationwide monitoring program aimed
at the detection of pathogens in commercial eucalypt plantations, Q.
eucalypti was found affecting Eucalyptus globulus in Portugal. The
identity of the pathogen was confirmed by sequence analyses of the
internal transcribed spacer (ITS) region of the rDNA operon, as well as
morphological characteristics. The results showed that Q. eucalypti is
widespread throughout the eucalypt producing areas of the country.
Pathogenicity studies revealed that different genotypes showed various
degrees of susceptibility to the pathogen. To our knowledge, this is the
first report of Q. eucalypti on Eucalyptus spp. in Portugal and in the
Northern hemisphere
